articles.author: Alex Navarro
articles.description:
Ethereum (ETH) has shown significant upward momentum, climbing over 5% in 24 hours to reach $2,669. This rally is underpinned not only by investor optimism, but by measurable shifts in trading behavior and liquidity dynamics.

This article breaks down the current ETH market surge, outlines technical resistance levels, and explains the role of High-Frequency Trading (HFT) and Market Making (MM) in shaping price behavior across exchanges.
Ethereum is approaching a key resistance level at $2,700, corresponding to the 200-day Simple Moving Average (SMA). If price action clears this level with volume confirmation, analysts project a movement toward the $3,500â€“$3,600 range.
Key Technical Highlights:
Current price: ~$2,669


Volume increase: +54% to $35.86 billion


Futures open interest growth: â€¦
articles.title: Ethereum Approaches $3,600: A Developerâ€™s Perspective on Price Dynamics, Market Making, and Technical Resistance

Command

100% open source on GitHub

npm test

âœ”ï¸ init, check, pack, restore â€” fully covered
MIT â€” do what you want.
WildEnv started as a simple idea to tame my .env files. Now it's a fully working, tested, multi-language tool.

articles.author: CliffordIsaboke
articles.description:
SQL (Structured Query Language) is the foundation of interacting with relational databases. Whether youâ€™re building a side project or working in a production environment, writing efficient and readable SQL can save you hours of debugging and optimization.
In this post, Iâ€™ll share 5 practical tips to help you write smarter SQLâ€”whether youâ€™re using PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQLite.
1. Be Specific with SELECT
Bad:
SELECT * FROM users;
Better:
SELECT id, name, email FROM users;
2.Use Table Aliases for Clarity
Bad:
SELECT * FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.id;
Cleaner:
SELECT o.id AS order_id, c.name AS customer_name
Good aliases make your queries easier to scan, especially in team environments or long queries.
3. Index Strategically
Example:
CREATE INDEX idx_users_email ON users(email);
SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = 'user@example.com';
4. Keep It DRY with Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
Instead of nesting subqueries:
SELECT name FROM (
Use a CTE:
WITH user_counts AS (
5. Use CASE for Conditional Logic
SELECT name,
This makes your logic explicit without post-processing in application code.
N/B:
SQL is simple on the surface, but powerful underneath. The more intentional you are with your queries, the better performance and maintainability youâ€™ll get.
articles.title: Write Smarter SQL: 5 Tips to Level Up Your Queries

articles.author: John Liter
articles.description:
Photo created using Grok
Itâ€™s tempting to let AI generate your code, debug your errors, and even design your projects. But  over-reliance on AI in 2025 could hurt your growth as a developer.
Hereâ€™s why you should  code first, ask AI secondâ€”and lean on developer communities to truly level up.
ğŸš¨ Top 10 Reasons to Not Depend on AI in 2025



  
  
  1ï¸âƒ£ AI Doesnâ€™t Teach You Problem-Solving




AI gives answers, not understanding.


You wonâ€™t learn why a solution worksâ€”just that it does.


Real skill comes from struggling, debugging, and figuring it out.




  
  
  2ï¸âƒ£ AI Code is Often Messy & Unoptimized




AI generates  working but inefficient  code.


Without reviewing it, youâ€™ll inherit  hidden bugs and tech debt.




  
  
  3ï¸âƒ£ AI Canâ€™t Replace Human Feedback




Developer communitiesâ€¦
articles.title: Why You Shouldnâ€™t Rely on AI in 2025 (And How Developer Communities Will Make You Better)

articles.author: Juraj
articles.description:
For the past couple of months, the concept of MCP has been booming. MCP (Model Context Protocol) was developed and released by the end of 2024 by Anthropic. It allows AI agents and LLMs to interact with third-party APIs in order to work with real data and allows them to make actions on your behalf.
In the case of a Redis MCP, as you will see further in the blog, it means that you can search through your database using natural language.
Now, to utilize MCP and allow it to interact with other APIs, you will need an MCP server that exposes tools for your agents to use.
The big question is how to run your MCP servers without making life harder for your developers. Having everyone set up their own local server is tedious and invites all kinds of inconsistencies. Centralizing it as a shared servâ€¦
articles.title: MCP Servers for Agentic Dev Platforms

articles.author: Vaibhav Kulshrestha
articles.description:
Letâ€™s uncover the layers of testing that silently fuel the worldâ€™s most reliable applications:
Testing isnâ€™t just about discovering defects â€” it's about ensuring confidence. It verifies business logic, validates user experience, and safeguards against regressions. Good testing builds trust â€” for both the team and the end-users.
Waiting until development ends to test is outdated. Modern QA begins during planning, collaborating with developers and analysts to write better stories, define edge cases, and prepare smarter test data.
Automation helps with speed, but itâ€™s not a magic wand. Understanding what to automate (and what not to) is key. A balanced strategy combining manual, exploratory, and automated testing leads to optimal results.
Todayâ€™s testers are not just script runners. Theyâ€™re quality advocates, embedded in agile teams, contributing to design reviews, writing testable requirements, and driving continuous improvement.
Stop counting just test cases and defect counts. Modern teams track defect leakage, test coverage gaps, and test debt â€” metrics that help assess not just quantity, but the impact and effectiveness of testing.
Software testing isnâ€™t a bottleneck â€” itâ€™s a business enabler. The faster we test well, the faster we ship with confidence. ğŸš€
articles.title: ğŸ¯ The Hidden Power of Software Testing in Modern Development

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Aaron Wood
articles.description:
As the question of stablecoin regulation heats up in the US Senate, so has the issue of which members are personally invested in cryptocurrencies and cryptocurrency firms. 
On May 19, the Senate voted to invoke cloture and move ahead with the GENIUS Act, which would provide a regulatory framework for stablecoins. The measure passed 66-32, with 16 Democrats supporting the bill.
Democratic concerns over corruption and politiciansâ€™ ties to cryptocurrency firms made the bipartisan move controversial. After the vote was finished, Colorado Senator Michael Bennet introduced the STABLE GENIUS Act. The bill would prevent members of Congress from issuing or investing in digital currency and require them to put their crypto in a blind trust while in office.
Bills to prevent members of Congress from iâ€¦
articles.title: Which senators invest in crypto? 11 lawmakers have blockchain-related investments

â€œYou donâ€™t own enough crypto. When you do, you donâ€™t own enough NFTâ€™s, as art is upstream of wealth. Both will never be this cheap again,â€ Pal said.

Understanding staking

â€œBy doing this, theyâ€™re saying, OK, weâ€™re taking this task of running the blockchain seriously. Here's some of our money. We're putting it down. We're showing that we're serious about doing this.â€

These investors had claimed over 8.9 billion British pounds ($11.9 billion) in damages, asserting that Binanceâ€™s delisting deprived holders of the chance to profit from BSVâ€™s potential rise to a â€œtop-tier cryptocurrencyâ€ like Bitcoin (BTC) or Bitcoin Cash (BCH).

Travelers using cryptocurrency for booking arrangements spend more than twice as much as regular travelers using fiat money, according to a joint report from Binance Pay and crypto travel platform Travala shared with Cointelegraph.
Crypto-based bookings on Travala reached $80 million in 2024, up from $45 million the year before. Crypto travelers are also outspending their fiat counterparts, with an average booking value ofÂ  $1,211 per transaction, over 2.5 times more than fiat users who spend $469.
Additionally, the report said crypto users were three times more valuable over their lifetime due to longer stays and higher repeat bookings, with crypto travelers 57% more likely to make a repeat hotel purchase.
Source: Binance Pay, Travala

articles.author: Cointelegraph by SK Arora
articles.description:
What is shilling in crypto?            
            
                
At its core, shilling is the act of artificially promoting a cryptocurrency or token, often with exaggerated claims, to increase its price or popularity.Â 
But whatâ€™s the goal?Â 
Hype it up, get others to buy in, and then cash out, leaving latecomers holding the bag.
Shilling can come from anyone: influencers, anonymous accounts or even high-profile figures with political or financial clout. The common thread is manipulation: Itâ€™s not about educating you or building real value but pumping hype for personal gain.
Unfortunately, the line between enthusiastic promotion and outright deception can be thin, and many fall victim without realizing it. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s critical to learn how to spot the signs early.
                 â€¦
articles.title: 5 red flags youâ€™re being shilled: Donâ€™t buy the hype

Coinbase hacker trolling ZachXBT. Source: ZachXBT.

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Pakistanâ€™s Ministry of Finance has reportedly endorsed the creation of a dedicated body to regulate blockchain-based financial infrastructure in the country.
The Pakistan Digital Assets Authority (PDAA) will serve as a regulatory body to oversee licensing, regulate exchanges, custodians, wallets, tokenized platforms, stablecoins and decentralized finance applications, according to a May 21 report from the state-owned broadcaster, PTV.
Muhammad Aurangzeb, federal minister for finance and revenue, told the broadcaster, â€œPakistan must regulate not just to catch up,Â but to leadâ€ in the industry.
â€œWith the PDAA, we are creating a future-ready framework that protects consumers, invites global investment, and puts Pakistan at the forefront of financial innovation,â€ he said.
Muhammad Aurangzeb, Paâ€¦
articles.title: Pakistan creates Digital Asset Authority to regulate crypto

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
A US grand jury has indicted the founder of blockchain startup Amalgam Capital Ventures over allegations he defrauded investors out of over $1 million with a fake blockchain.
Jeremy Jordan-Jones was arrested and indicted on May 21 and charged with wire fraud, securities fraud, making false statements to a bank, and aggravated identity theft, the Department of Justice said on May 21.Â Â 
Manhattan US Attorney Jay Clayton claimed Jordan-Jones â€œtouted his company as a groundbreaking blockchain startup,â€ but alleged that, in reality, the â€œcompany was a sham, and investorsâ€™ funds were siphoned off to bankroll his lavish lifestyle.â€
FBI Assistant Director Christopher Raia alleged that Jordan-Jones defrauded investors of more than 1 million dollars through â€œmisrepresentations of his purported compaâ€¦
articles.title: Feds charge Amalgam founder with stealing $1M via â€˜shamâ€™ blockchain

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A crypto whale has expanded an existing 40x leverage long Bitcoin bet to $1.1 billion on the decentralized exchange Hyperliquid, which has stunned the crypto community and is believed to be the first-ever position exceeding $1 billion on the platform.
The X account â€œJames Wynnâ€ claims to be behind the position, which is now up $36 million on the trade, data from Hypurrscanâ€™s block explorer shows.
A $28.4 million margin position was used across several trades to increase the Bitcoin (BTC) position, now worth $1.13 billion. The average Bitcoin entry price was $108,065.
Perp futures positions of wallet address â€œ0x507.â€ Source: Hypurrscan
â€œHe did it fellas,â€ crypto analyst Sigma^2 wrote on X. â€œFirst position [on Hyperliquid] to exceed $1B.â€
Wynnâ€™s long position was at a loss of about $16.3 milâ€¦
articles.title: Hyperliquid sees $1.1B Bitcoin long bet opened at 40x leverage

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
BlackRockâ€™s iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) has seen its largest inflow in the past two weeks as traders allocate to US spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) to scoop up the rocketing cryptocurrency.
IBITâ€™s May 21 net inflows hit $530.6 million, its biggest single-day net inflow since it took in $531.2 million on May 5, according to Farside Investors. The ETF hasnâ€™t had an outflow since April 9.
In one day alone, IBIT has accumulated over 10 times the amount of Bitcoin (BTC) mined over the same timeframe, with it scooping up 4,931 BTC against just 450 BTC produced for the day.
IBIT also saw its largest volume day since January, according to the ETF tracking X account Trader T.Â 
â€œGiven trading volume today, expect these inflow numbers to increase,â€ said ETF Store president Nate Geraci.Â 
Blâ€¦
articles.title: BlackRockâ€™s Bitcoin ETF notches 2-week high inflow as BTC nears $112K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Decentralized finance platform Synthetix has axed its $27 million plan to acquire crypto options platform Derive after negative community feedback.
A Synthetix spokesperson told Cointelegraph on May 22 that its acquisition proposal, pitched to its community and to Deriveâ€™s, â€œdid not resonate,â€ and both projects agreed to â€œstep back from the proposed acquisition.â€
Synthetix said on May 14 that it would acquire Derive in a token exchange deal, pricing 1 SNX token to 27 DRV tokens, which would value Derive at around $27 million, pending approval from both communities.Â 
Synthetix strategy lead Ben Celermajer told Cointelegraph that other community concerns were the three-month token lock-up period and the dealâ€™s price, part of which Synthetix tried to address with no lock-up for holders of lesâ€¦
articles.title: Synthetix scuttles $27M Derive deal after community concerns

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Bitcoin has topped $110,000 for the first time in a recent rally that has seen it gain 3% over the past day to break through past price highs from earlier this year.
Bitcoin (BTC) hit a new all-time high of $110,788.98 on Coinbase late on May 21, just before 11:30 pm UTC, according to TradingView.
Bitcoin has gained around 3% over the last 24 hours, surpassing its all-time high of $109,458 that it hit earlier in the day, which was the first time it traded above its previously long-held Jan. 20 peak.
The worldâ€™s largest cryptocurrency has now gained 17.5% so far this year and is up 47% since its slump to $75,000 on April 7, triggered by US President Donald Trump enacting sweeping tariffs that tanked global markets.
Bitcoinâ€™s new peak comes as US stock markets were rattled by a weak 20-year â€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin continues rally to surpass $110K for the first time

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Crypto influencer Anthony Pomplianoâ€™s fintech-focused blank-check company, ProCap Acquisition Corp (PCAPU), rose 7% on its debut Nasdaq listing after a last-minute upsizing of its initial public offering.
ProCap had boosted its IPO from $200 million to $220 million on May 20, a day before its public launch, pricing its 22 million shares on offer at $10 each.
ProCap shares closed the May 21 trading day up 7% at $10.70, which continued with a 1.6% bump after-hours to $10.87, Yahoo Finance data shows.
PCAPUâ€™s share price closed up 7% on its debut trading day. Source: Yahoo Finance
The company has offered underwriters a 45-day option to buy up to 3.3 million additional shares at the IPO price to cover extra demand.
ProCap said in an April 30 regulatory filing that the firm will be a Special Puâ€¦
articles.title: Pompliano-led crypto-focused SPAC gains 7% on Nasdaq after upsized IPO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Australiaâ€™s financial regulator will seek the High Courtâ€™s permission to appeal a lower courtâ€™s ruling favoring fintech firm Block Earner, which found the companyâ€™s crypto-linked fixed-yield earning service is not a financial product.
The Australian Securities and Investment Commission said on May 21 that it wants to ask the High Court of Australia to clarify what the definition of a financial product is and clarify the circumstances when an interest-earning product and the conversion of assets from one form to another are regulated.
â€œThe definition of financial product was drafted in a broad and technology-neutral way, and ASIC believes it is in the public interest to clarify this,â€ the watchdog said.
â€œThis clarification is important as it applies to all financial products and services whâ€¦
articles.title: Australian regulator asks High Court to allow appeal in Block Earner case

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex Oâ€™Donnell
articles.description:
VanEck plans to launch a private digital assets fund in June targeting tokenized Web3 projects built on the Avalanche blockchain network, the asset manager said in a statement shared with Cointelegraph.
The VanEck PurposeBuilt Fund, available only to accredited investors, aims to invest in liquid tokens and venture-backed projects across Web3 sectors, including gaming, financial services, payments, and artificial intelligence.Â 
Idle capital will be deployed into Avalanche (AVAX) real-world asset (RWA) products, including tokenized money market funds, VanEck said.
The fund will be managed by the team behind VanEckâ€™s Digital Assets Alpha Fund (DAAF), which oversees more than $100 million in net assets as of May 21.Â 
â€œThe next wave of value in crypto will come from real businesses, not more iâ€¦
articles.title: VanEck to launch Avalanche ecosystem fund
